content:
California State University Stanislaus held its fifth annual ThankAVeteran event Nov PERIOD  from  a.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD in the quad PERIOD The CSU Stanislaus Veterans Affairs Office invited veterans and the general public to this event and expressed appreciation to former service members for their service and sacrifice PERIOD

CSU Stanislaus Veterans Affairs has worked to build and maintain a community for students staff faculty and alumni who have served in the U.S PERIOD military PERIOD They advocate for a seamless transition from military life to civilian college life and provide support for continued growth in mind body and spirit PERIOD

The office encourages veterans to take the pride and confidence established in the military into their college experience as well as into their future careers as veteran alumni PERIOD

ThankaVeteran is an event for the campus and community to show recognition and gratitude to local veterans PERIOD The event brought awareness to civilians but also allowed veterans to start conversations with fellow veterans as well as civilian students PERIOD

Our veteran students take advantage of the organizations in attendance to learn about their services Nadine Kent Veterans Affairs coordinator said PERIOD

U.S PERIOD Representative Jeff Denham who served  years in the U.S PERIOD Air Force during Operation Desert Storm in the Gulf War and Operation Restore Hope in Somalia attended the event PERIOD

According to Denham the event is important because veterans are returning home and looking for a better education and the CSU Stanislaus Troops to College program is giving them that opportunity PERIOD

CSU Stanislaus students Army Reservist Jaime Kulik and Marine Reservist David Contreras saluted during the commemoration of the Veterans Day ceremony PERIOD

Its hard to juggle both worlds of being in the reserve and a student but it is rewarding to have a B.A. contreras said at the event PERIOD

Kulik expressed that she made the right decision to be a part of the Army reserve PERIOD

Its been a good experience I am very glad I did it Kulik said PERIOD

Its been a great commitment to finish school at the same time. cSU Stanislaus earned recognition as a Military Friendly School and the Veterans Affairs Office is working diligently to continuously improve education experiences for veteran students PERIOD

Its an honor for CSU Stanislaus to be nationally recognized as a Military Friendly School Kent said PERIOD

This event brings together all generations of veterans and longlasting bonds are formed and new friendships are made. veterans from around the region along with CSU Stanislaus alumni return every year to enjoy the event PERIOD

For more information or dates for upcoming veteran events visit CSU Stanislaus Veterans Affairs Office located in the Mary Stuart Rogers Building Enrollment Services Office MSR  or call the office at  PERIOD
